title: Oath Keepers
added: [[Richard Ivan Mack]] a former sheriff of [[Graham County, Arizona]] and a political activist. He is known for his role in a successful lawsuit brought against the federal government of the United States which alleged that portions of the [[Brady Handgun Violence Prevention Act]] violated the [[United States Constitution]]. He is a former lobbyist for [[Gun Owners of America]] (GOA) and a two-time candidate for [[United States Congress]]. Mack is also the founder of [[Constitutional Sheriffs and Peace Officers Association]] (CSPOA), and established the "County Sheriff Project" movement, both of whom reaffirm what they claim is the constitutional power to refuse to enforce federal laws.<ref name="NEWS21">{{cite web|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/investigations/no-sheriff-town-some-lawmen-refuse-enforce-federal-gun-laws-n185426 |title='No' Sheriff in Town: Some Lawmen Refuse to Enforce Federal Gun Laws |publisher=[[NBC News]] |date= |accessdate=2016-05-20}}</ref> He is an Oath Keepers Board Member.
